intro: Vitex lehmbachii, commonly known as the Lehmbach's vitex, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the verbena family (Verbenaceae) and is characterized by its opposite leaves and showy, clustered flowers that range in color from purple to white. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters, and thrives in well-drained soils. Its fruit is a small, dry capsule that contains numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind.
